message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. It's a one-of-a-kind item that I'm confident you'll love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $120.

Thanks for the offer, Alice. I appreciate you being willing to negotiate. However, $120 is a bit more than I'm comfortable spending right now. I'm willing to pay $85 for the product. What do you think?

I understand that $120 is a bit steep for you, Bob. However, I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'm counteroffering at $105. I think this is a fair price considering the product's value. What do you think?

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $105 is still a bit too high for me. I'm happy to pay $90 for the product. This is my final offer, as I'm also considering other options. Let me know what you think.

I understand that you're trying to get the best deal, Bob, but I'm not willing to go as low as $90. I'm willing to make one more compromise. I'll counteroffer at $100. This is my final offer, as I'm also considering other options. Let me know what you think.

Alice, I'm really trying to get this deal done, but $100 is still too much for me. Let's split the difference â€“ I'll pay $95. If you're not willing to go lower, I'm going to have to consider my other options.

I understand that you're trying to get a good deal, Bob, but I'm not willing to go as low as $95. I'm willing to make one more compromise. I'll counteroffer at $98. This is my final offer, as I'm also considering other options. Let me know what you think.
